Class oracle.html.HtmlBody 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index  OWS Table of Contents

Class oracle.html.HtmlBody 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----oracle.html.Container
           |
           +----oracle.html.HtmlBody
public class HtmlBody
extends Container

Description:

HtmlBody class encapsulates the BODY part of an HTML Document.

An HtmlBody object consists of a collection/list of objects that either derive from Item class or implements IHtmlItem interface.

Example:

It's easy to create and add items to HtmlBody, all you need to do is to create a new HtmlBody object, set the body-specific attributes, then add all the items you want to be included in the final HTML page to it: 

// Create a new HtmlBody object
HtmlBody body = new HtmlBody();
// set attributes
body.setBackgroundImage("images/grey.gif");
// Create a new simple item
SimpleItem item = new SimpleItem("This is an item.");
// Add an item to HtmlBody object
body.addItem(item);

Note:

You can easily create resuable components by creating Container objects and add them to body. Or you can simple derive your customized class from Item or Container (with parameters, for example, to customize its appearance) and add them to HtmlBody object.

See Also:
HtmlPage, HtmlHead, IHtmlItem, Container, Item, Color
